abstract: Catherine Hanaway restarts campaign for Republican gubernatorial nomination in Missouri, a little more than a month after suicide of her opponent Tom Schweich; campaign's hiatus served not only as mourning period, but also allowed Hanaway to shield herself from critics who suggest that brutal campaign against Schweich by Hanaway's supporters contributed to his suicide.
lead_paragraph: Catherine Hanaway eased back into the race for governor a month after Tom Schweich, a candidate for the Republican nomination, committed suicide. Some close to Mr. Schweich blame his death, at least in part, on a brutal campaign against him.

headline.main: Missouri Candidate Picks Up Where She Left Off After Rival’s Suicide
headline.print_headline: Missouri Candidate Picks Up Where She Left Off After Rival’s Suicide

snippet: Catherine Hanaway eased back into the race for governor a month after Tom Schweich, a candidate for the Republican nomination, committed suicide. Some close to Mr. Schweich blame his death, at least in part, on a brutal campaign against him.
